author: felixweber
title: Ryuki Funding
description: The Catalyst Community needs a fast & community driven mechanism to reward & fund engagements & activities besides submitting proposals.

author: joshf
title: Catalyst Treasury Management
description: Funded proposals require a treasury and portfolio management tool beyond spreadsheets in order to track inflows and outflows.

author: mark
title: Cardano Hackathon Seasons
description: Current Catalyst fund cadence and proposal structure does not incentivize proactive rapid creation and of tools, products or services.

author: dwayne
title: DAO-NET: CryptoFusion Funder
description: Project Catalyst is a series of experiments however funding experiments are not being run concurrently to speed up the evolutionary process.

author: quasar
title: Mechanism Templates for Funding
description: Current Catalyst funding mechanism can't facilitate rapid funding, due to the infrastructure of ideascale.

author: vilela
title: AdaQuad - Crowdfunding Platform
description: How can we develop a quick collective decision-making funding method that also balances the voting power of quite different wallet sizes?

author: nielskijf
title: Fund Builder for DAO's (Adagov/SDA)
description: Project Catalyst is static and linear causing scaling and delay issues; preventing teams with promising projects from choosing Cardano.

author: toby
title: Project-viewer for Catalyst
description: As of now, there is no transparent, public, and easy accessible way to record and categorize Catalyst projects. Catalyst has no overview.

author: huths0lo
title: AdaFundMe.io
description: There are not yet any public websites to raise funds using Cardano Ada.

author: nvhieu
title: Automated funding catalyst projects
description: The Catalyst support team is funding proposals manually, This mechanism requires a lot of time and effort

author: nxr
title: Rapid Funding with ML Voting Agents
description: Multiple objectives and broad-community voting make it hard to quickly provide funding to urgent projects while ensuring their quality.

author: tevosaks
title: Proposal Workshop
description: Participants are discouraged to work on continuous improvements using the current Project Catalyst funding model

author: sofi.heessen
title: AKI: Agile Katalyst Intrapreneurs
description: The current funding system requires work to be planned in advance. Rapid Funding without it requires other forms of input and accountability

author: ccadminteam
title: Catalyst Circle - Funding Mechanism
description: Funding from Project Catalyst requires several months before funds are available. Critical initiatives need faster funding.

author: wolstaeb
title: Retroactive Financing Experiment
description: Collective decisions are limited by the information and expertise the community has access to, that lead to misallocation if left unchecked.
